IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Reducing extreme poverty and restoring healthy forests.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To offer the dignity of fair employment to people living in impoverished communities, who become transformational agents of global forest restoration.
IRS990.Desc: In 2021, Eden Reforestation Projects planted over 350 million trees in Haiti, Madagascar, Nepal, Mozambique, Kenya, Indonesia and Central America and provided employment for thousands of local people.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule A, Part II, Line 10, Explanation of Other Income:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: Other income - 2019 Amount: $ 33. 2020 Amount: $ 8,127. 2021 Amount: $ 30. Loss from operations - 2021 Amount: $ -300,000.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: To provide long-term funding for forest guards and other resources to protect planting sites

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.TypeOfActivitiesConductedTxt: Grants to recipients located in the region
Grants to recipients located in the region
Grants to recipients located in the region
Grants to recipients located in the region
Grants to recipients located in the region

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All foreign grants are issued exclusively to affiliated NGOs who share a common CEO with Eden Reforestation Projects (US). The affiliated NGOs send monthly reports on finances, planting, and employment statistics as well as verification photos and other data related to planting projects.
The accrual method of accounting is used for foreign expendiures.

The following individuals reported on Form 990, Part VII, received a discretionary year-end bonus which was set and approved by the board of directors. Stephen Fitch Ian Bergland Debra Crawford Sehr Ali Edith Stone Mark Usellis James Shattenberg Dustin Cole Roland Gutierrez

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: Family member of CEO owns more than 35% of organization

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The number of contributions represent the number of contributions received, not the number of items donated.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 5
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: During the tax year it was discovered that $300,000 of funds sent to a grantee organization were misappropriated by an employee of the grantee organization. In response to this event, Eden Reforestation Projects has implemented stronger controls for proper oversight of the use/reporting of grant funds. A formal ERP accounting system was put in place, and monthly financial statements and bank reconciliations are being produced by the grantee nation. They are submitted and reviewed by ERP's international accountant.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990 is prepared by an independent CPA firm and reviewed in detail by the organization's top management. The reviewed Form 990 is then provided to the board of directors prior to filing with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization requires all officers and board members to annually complete and sign a conflict of interest questionnaire. The Director of Finance is responsible for reviewing the signed statements and ensuring that interested persons are in compliance with the conflict of interest policy. The CEO reviews the Director of Finance's statement. Should any potential conflicts of interest be disclosed, the board member or officer would be asked to refrain from participation in any deliberation or decision with regard to matters affected by the relationship.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Independent members of the board review and approve compensation for all officers and key employees using industry averages. The process and outcome of such discussions is documented in the board minutes.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements are available upon request.
